reviews.text: Kew Bridge station is definitely not accessible - there are no lifts, just plenty of stairs. You can get to Waterloo in 20min - assuming you don't have a buggy or a wheelchair, such a pity! Ticket machines only, no staff. There's a bus stop just outside the station (267, 237, 391, N9), plus another one a couple of minutes away (65). There's a cafe open during the day, a pub, Costa and a Sainsbury's Local all at walking distance.

The train station of the KEW Bridge is in a key place because it is 8-10 minutes from Gunnersbury, the metro station through which a district line and overground  in one direction with the stop Richmond station and the other on the lines of both modes of transport for Central London. The train is reached for 20 minutes to Clapham Junstion. The stop is equipped with everything you need. 
I recommend it as convenient and fast transportation. 
5 stars.
No facilties beyond a shelter, two Oyster card readers and two ticket machines; the east bound machine is often out of service.
